description: This course will introduce students to current theory and practice in the field of relationship counselling. It will recognise the importance of relationships to our ongoing life satisfaction and wellbeing. It will also examine the complexities of family and culture of origin issues as these pertain to relationship dynamics. Students will be introduced to evidence-based realtionship approaches, with an emphasis on the administration and interpretation of assessment for couples counselling.
restricted: Restricted to students enrolled in MPsychClin, MPsych, DPsych or with permission of Director of Psychology programs.
